text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
PractitionerRole 0..*FrPractitionerRoleExerciceRoles/organizations the practitioner is associated with
meta
as-data-trace S0..1(Complex)DataTrace
URL: https://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/annuaire/StructureDefinition/as-data-trace
as-ext-practitionerrole-name S0..*HumanNameLa civilité, le nom et le prénom sous lequels exerce le professionnel.
URL: https://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/annuaire/StructureDefinition/as-ext-practitionerrole-name
as-ext-practitionerrole-registration S0..*(Complex)Eléments permettant de retrouver les informations d'inscription à un ordre par rapport à la profession de la personne physique sur une période et un département donné.
URL: https://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/annuaire/StructureDefinition/as-ext-practitionerrole-registration
as-ext-practitionerrole-education-level S0..*(Complex)niveauFormation
URL: https://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/annuaire/StructureDefinition/as-ext-practitionerrole-education-level
as-ext-practitionerrole-smartcard S0..*(Complex)Données descriptives du moyen d’identification des personnes physiques via une carte de professionnel.
URL: https://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/annuaire/StructureDefinition/as-ext-practitionerrole-smartcard
as-ext-digital-certificate S0..*(Complex)AS Digital Certificate Extension
URL: https://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/annuaire/StructureDefinition/as-ext-digital-certificate
as-ext-practitionerrole-end-cause S0..1CodeableConceptMotif de fin d'activité, par exemple: décès, retraite libérale, changement de profession, etc.
URL: https://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/annuaire/StructureDefinition/as-ext-practitionerrole-end-cause
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J92-MotifFinActivite-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J92-MotifFinActivite-RASS (required): Liste des motifs de fin d'activité.

as-ext-practitionerrole-contracted S0..1CodeableConceptSecteur de conventionnement du professionnel libéral auquel il a adhéré auprès de l'Assurance Maladie.
URL: https://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/annuaire/StructureDefinition/as-ext-practitionerrole-contracted
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J130-CNAMAmeliSecteurConventionnement-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J130-CNAMAmeliSecteurConventionnement-RASS (required): Liste des conventionnement CNAM.

as-ext-practitionerrole-hascas S0..1booleanOPTAM est un dispositif proposé par l’Assurance Maladie aux médecins conventionnés, ayant pour objectif principal de faciliter l’accès aux soins.
URL: https://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/annuaire/StructureDefinition/as-ext-practitionerrole-hascas
as-ext-practitionerrole-vitale-accepted S0..1booleanL’indicateur Carte Vitale acceptée précisant si le professionnel, dans le cadre de cette situation opérationnelle, dispose des moyens techniques pour prendre en charge la carte vitale ou pas.
URL: https://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/annuaire/StructureDefinition/as-ext-practitionerrole-vitale-accepted
identifier S0..*Identifieridentifiant métier calculé à partir des identifiants techniques de l'exercice professionnel et la situation d'exercice.
system 0..1urisystem (https://annuaire.sante.fr par défaut).
value 0..1stringIdentifiant technique de l'activité.
active S0..1booleanLa situation d'exercice est-elle active? (active | inactive)
period S0..1PeriodPériode d'activité de la situation d'exercice.
start 0..1dateTime[Donnée restreinte] : Date de début de l’activité correspondant à la date d’installation en cabinet ou à la date d’embauche du salarié.
end 0..1dateTime[Donnée restreinte] : Date de fin de l’activité.
practitioner S0..1Reference(FrPractitioner)Référence permettant de lier l’exercice professionnel et la situation d'exercice à un professionnel (Practitioner).
organization S0..1Reference(FrOrganization)Référence vers l’EG ou EJ de rattachement de la situation d’exercice (Organization)
code
Slices for coding 0..*CodingCode defined by a terminology system
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:system
coding:CategorieProfession S0..1CodingCatégorie professionnelle indiqant si le professionnel exerce sa profession en tant que Militaire, Civil, Fonctionnaire ou Etudiant.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J89-CategorieProfessionnelle-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J89-CategorieProfessionnelle-RASS (required): Liste des catégories professionnelles

coding:professionG15 S0..1CodingProfession exercée ou future profession de l'étudiant.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J106-EnsembleProfession-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J106-EnsembleProfession-RASS (required): Liste des professions de santé définies par le code de la santé publique

coding:professionR94 S0..1CodingProfession du social.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J106-EnsembleProfession-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J106-EnsembleProfession-RASS (required): Liste des professions du social

coding:professionR95 S0..1CodingProfession à usage de titre professionnel.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J106-EnsembleProfession-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J106-EnsembleProfession-RASS (required): Liste des professions à usage de titre professionnel

coding:professionR291 S0..1Codingprofessionnel non membre d'une profession réglementée.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J106-EnsembleProfession-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J106-EnsembleProfession-RASS (required): Liste de professionnels non membres d'une profession réglementée

coding:genreActivite S0..1CodingLe genre identifiant une activité qui nécessite l’application de règles de gestion spécifiques.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J94-GenreActivite-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J94-GenreActivite-RASS (required): Liste des genres d'activité

coding:modeExercice S0..1CodingLe mode d'exercice décrit selon quelle modalité une activité est exercée au regard de l'organisation de la rétribution du professionnel.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J95-ModeExercice-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J95-ModeExercice-RASS (required): Liste des modes d'exercice

coding:typeActiviteLiberale S0..1CodingType d’activité libérale, par exemple: Cabinet; Secteur privé à l'hôpital.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J96-TypeActiviteLiberale-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J96-TypeActiviteLiberale-RASS (required): Liste des types d’activité

coding:statutProfessionnelSSA S0..1CodingStatut du professionnel du Service de santé des armées.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J97-StatutProfessionnelSSA-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J97-StatutProfessionnelSSA-RASS (required): Liste des statuts SSA

coding:statutHospitalier S0..1CodingStatut hospitalier dans le cas d’une activité exercée en établissement public de santé.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J98-StatutHospitalier-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J98-StatutHospitalier-RASS (required): Liste des statuts hospitaliers

coding:fonctionR21 S0..1CodingFonction du professionnel au sein de la structure d’exercice.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J108-EnsembleFonction-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J108-EnsembleFonction-RASS (required): Liste des fonctions et rôles

coding:fonctionR96 S0..1CodingAutre fonction du domaine sanitaire exercée par le professionnel au sein de la structure d’exercice.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J108-EnsembleFonction-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J108-EnsembleFonction-RASS (required): Liste des fonctions et rôles

coding:fonctionR85 S0..1CodingRôle du professionnel dans la prise en charge des patients ou des usagers.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J108-EnsembleFonction-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J108-EnsembleFonction-RASS (required): Liste des rôles

coding:metierPharmacienR06 S0..1CodingSection du tableau de l’Ordre des pharmaciens (CNOP).
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J73-MetierPharmacien-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J73-MetierPharmacien-RASS (required): Liste des sections du tableau CNOP

coding:metierPharmacienG05 S0..1CodingSous-section ou à défaut section du tableau de l’Ordre des pharmaciens (CNOP).
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J73-MetierPharmacien-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J73-MetierPharmacien-RASS (required): Liste des sous-sections du tableau CNOP

Slices for specialty 0..*AsCodeableConceptTimedProfileConcept - reference to a terminology or just text
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:coding.system
specialty:attributionParticuliere S0..*CodeableConceptActivité ponctuelle du professionnel de type expertise.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J90-AttributionParticuliere-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J90-AttributionParticuliere-RASS (required)
specialty:savoirFaireR38 S0..*CodeableConceptSpécialité ordinale reconnue par une autorité d'enregistrement (Ordre ou SSA).
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS (required): Liste des spécialités ordinales


specialty:savoirFaireR39 S0..*CodeableConceptCompétence acquise par le professionnel.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS (required): Liste des compétences


specialty:savoirFaireR40 S0..*CodeableConceptCompétence exclusive exercée par le professionnel à titre exclusif.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS (required): Liste des compétences exclusives


specialty:savoirFaireR42 S0..*CodeableConceptDiplôme d'études spécialisées complémentaires (DESC).
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS (required): Liste des DESC


specialty:savoirFaireR43 S0..*CodeableConceptCapacité (savoir-faire)d e médecine
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS (required): Liste des capacités


specialty:savoirFaireR44 S0..*CodeableConceptQualification de praticien adjoint contractuel.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS (required): Liste des qualifications


specialty:savoirFaireR45 S0..*CodeableConceptFonction qualifiée.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS (required): Liste des fonctions qualifiées


specialty:savoirFaireR97 S0..*CodeableConceptDroit d'exercice complémentaire.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS (required): Liste des droits d'exercice complémentaires


specialty:savoirFaireG13 S0..*CodeableConceptOrientation particulière.
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J107-EnsembleSavoirFaire-RASS (required): Liste des orientations particulières


specialty:typeSavoirFaire S0..*CodeableConceptLe type de savoir-faire (qualifications/autres attributions).
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J91-TypeSavoirFaire-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J91-TypeSavoirFaire-RASS (required): Liste des types de savoir-faire


location S0..*Reference(FrLocation)Référence vers la location dans PractitionerRole.contained représentant les coordonnées de l'activité.
healthcareService S0..*Reference(FrHealthcareService)The list of healthcare services that this worker provides for this role's Organization/Location(s)
Slices for telecom S0..*FrContactPointDetails of a Technology mediated contact point | Coordonnées électroniques détaillées
Slice: Unordered, Open by pattern:code
telecom:mailbox-mss 0..*AsMailboxMSSProfileBALs MSS de type PER rattachés à l'identifiant du professionnel de santé ainsi qu'au lieu de sa situation d'exercice.
availableTime S0..*BackboneElementTimes the Service Site is available
notAvailable S0..*BackboneElementNot available during this time due to provided reason
availabilityExceptions S0..1stringDescription of availability exceptions
endpoint S0..*Reference(Endpoint)Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the practitioner with this role

Documentation for this format

name: AsPractitionerRoleProfile
title: AS PractitionerRole Profile
description: Profil créé à partir de FrPractitionerRoleExercice dans le contexte de l'Annuaire Santé pour décrire l'exercice professionel et la situation d'exercice | contient les informations décrivant notamment la profession exercée, l'identité d'exercice d'un professionnel, le cadre de son exercice (civil, militaire, etc.) ainsi que les caractéristiques de l'exercice d’un professionnel pendant une période déterminée et dans une structure déterminée.

element.short: Roles/organizations the practitioner is associated with
element.definition: A specific set of Roles/Locations/specialties/services that a practitioner may perform at an organization for a period of time.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.short: Logical id of this artifact
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.short: Metadata about the resource
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: DataTrace
element.definition: Informe sur l'origine de la donnée (Autorité d'Enregistrement (AE) et Système d'Information (SI))..

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Version specific identifier
element.definition: The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the URL. This value changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.
element.comment: The server assigns this value, and ignores what the client specifies, except in the case that the server is imposing version integrity on updates/deletes.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the resource version last changed
element.definition: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.
element.comment: This value is always populated except when the resource is first being created. The server / resource manager sets this value; what a client provides is irrelevant. This is equivalent to the HTTP Last-Modified and SHOULD have the same value on a [read](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#read) interaction.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Identifies where the resource comes from
element.definition: A uri that identifies the source system of the resource. This provides a minimal amount of [Provenance](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/provenance.html#) information that can be used to track or differentiate the source of information in the resource. The source may identify another FHIR server, document, message, database, etc.
element.comment:
In the provenance resource, this corresponds to Provenance.entity.what[x]. The exact use of the source (and the implied Provenance.entity.role) is left to implementer discretion. Only one nominated source is allowed; for additional provenance details, a full Provenance resource should be used. 

This element can be used to indicate where the current master source of a resource that has a canonical URL if the resource is no longer hosted at the canonical URL.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Profiles this resource claims to conform to
element.definition: A list of profiles (references to [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#) resources) that this resource claims to conform to. The URL is a reference to [StructureDefinition.url](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition-definitions.html#StructureDefinition.url).
element.comment: It is up to the server and/or other infrastructure of policy to determine whether/how these claims are verified and/or updated over time.  The list of profile URLs is a set.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Security Labels applied to this resource
element.definition: Security labels applied to this resource. These tags connect specific resources to the overall security policy and infrastructure.
element.comment: The security labels can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of security labels is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Security Labels from the Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System.

element.short: Tags applied to this resource
element.definition: Tags applied to this resource. Tags are intended to be used to identify and relate resources to process and workflow, and applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of a resource.
element.comment: The tags can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of tags is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes that represent various types of tags, commonly workflow-related; e.g. "Needs review by Dr. Jones".

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.short: Language of the resource content
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contained, inline Resources
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.short: Extension
element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Optional Extensions Element
element.definition: Optional Extension Element - found in all resources.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: La civilité, le nom et le prénom sous lequels exerce le professionnel.
element.definition: Extension créée dans le cadre de l'Annuaire Santé pour définir l'identité d’exercice d’un professionnel.
element.comment: Concaténation des champs MOS : civilite + nomExercice + prenom

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Eléments permettant de retrouver les informations d'inscription à un ordre par rapport à la profession de la personne physique sur une période et un département donné.
element.definition: Extension créée dans le cadre de l'Annuaire Santé pour prise en compte de la première inscription si "isFirst = true".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: niveauFormation
element.definition: Le niveau de formation.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Données descriptives du moyen d’identification des personnes physiques via une carte de professionnel.
element.definition: Extension créée dans le cadre de l'Annuaire Santé pour décrire les informations de la carte CPx utilisée comme moyen d’identification des personnes physiques.
element.comment:
Synonyme : CarteProfessionnel 
 La carte est rattachée à l’exercice d’une profession donnée et non au professionnel lui-même, un professionnel exerçant simultanément deux professions a deux cartes

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: AS Digital Certificate Extension
element.definition: Extension créée dans le cadre de l'Annuaire Santé pour décrire les certificats utilisés par les professionnels et les structures comme moyen d'identification.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Motif de fin d'activité, par exemple: décès, retraite libérale, changement de profession, etc.
element.definition: Extension créée dans le cadre de l'Annuaire Santé pour décrire le motif de fin d'activité du professionnel (décès, retraite libérale, changement de profession par exemple.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Secteur de conventionnement du professionnel libéral auquel il a adhéré auprès de l'Assurance Maladie.
element.definition: Extension créée dans le cadre de l'Annuaire Santé pour décrire le secteur de conventionnement du professionnel libéral auquel il a adhéré auprès de l'Assurance Maladie.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: OPTAM est un dispositif proposé par l’Assurance Maladie aux médecins conventionnés, ayant pour objectif principal de faciliter l’accès aux soins.
element.definition: Extension créée dans le cadre de l'Annuaire Santé pour décrire le contrat d'accès aux soins (CAS), remplacée récemment par l'option pratique tarifaire maîtrisée (OPTAM).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: L’indicateur Carte Vitale acceptée précisant si le professionnel, dans le cadre de cette situation opérationnelle, dispose des moyens techniques pour prendre en charge la carte vitale ou pas.
element.definition: Extension créée dans le cadre de l'Annuaire Santé pour décrire l’indicateur Carte Vitale acceptée (oui/non).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

element.short: usual | official | temp | secondary | old (If known)
element.definition: The purpose of this identifier.
element.comment: Applications can assume that an identifier is permanent unless it explicitly says that it is temporary.
element.requirements: Allows the appropriate identifier for a particular context of use to be selected from among a set of identifiers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not mistake a temporary id for a permanent one.

element.short: Description of identifier
element.definition: A coded type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.
element.comment: This element deals only with general categories of identifiers.  It SHOULD not be used for codes that correspond 1..1 with the Identifier.system. Some identifiers may fall into multiple categories due to common usage.   Where the system is known, a type is unnecessary because the type is always part of the system definition. However systems often need to handle identifiers where the system is not known. There is not a 1:1 relationship between type and system, since many different systems have the same type.
element.requirements: Allows users to make use of identifiers when the identifier system is not known.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A coded type for an identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

element.short: system (https://annuaire.sante.fr par défaut).
element.definition:
Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.
Namespace du RASS (inconnu à ce jour)
element.requirements: There are many sets  of identifiers.  To perform matching of two identifiers, we need to know what set we're dealing with. The system identifies a particular set of unique identifiers.

element.definition: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means no end was known or planned at the time the instance was created. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.
element.meaningWhenMissing: If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing

Profession exercée ou future profession de l'étudiant.

element.short: Le genre identifiant une activité qui nécessite l’application de règles de gestion spécifiques.
Le mode d'exercice décrit selon quelle modalité une activité est exercée au regard de l'organisation de la rétribution du professionnel.
Type d’activité libérale, par exemple: Cabinet; Secteur privé à l'hôpital.
Statut du professionnel du Service de santé des armées.
Statut hospitalier dans le cas d’une activité exercée en établissement public de santé.
Fonction du professionnel au sein de la structure d’exercice.
Autre fonction du domaine sanitaire exercée par le professionnel au sein de la structure d’exercice.
Rôle du professionnel dans la prise en charge des patients ou des usagers.
